passage_text: Average Cape Cod Temperatures By Month. Seasonal temperatures on Cape Cod are relatively mild due to the Cape being surrounded by water. This keeps the Cape’s average temperatures cooler in Summer and warmer in Winter.

Average monthly precipitation in April is 3.5 inches. In May, it finally starts to warm up a bit, with average temperatures between 48 degrees and 62 degrees and average monthly precipitation of about 3 inches. September 's weather is a lot like July and August, only a bit cooler. Temperatures typically range between 55 degrees and 70 degrees and average precipitation during the month is 3.7 inches. It gets a little cooler later in the month, so bring along a light jacket.

By July and August, full summer weather hits Cape Cod and temperatures are typically between 62 degrees and 78 degrees. Average monthly precipitation is about 3 inches. You should bring your swimsuit and plenty of summer clothing, but also a few warmer items for nighttime and the cool beach breezes. September 's weather is a lot like July and August, only a bit cooler. Temperatures typically range between 55 degrees and 70 degrees and average precipitation during the month is 3.7 inches. It gets a little cooler later in the month, so bring along a light jacket.

Autumn Rains. April and May are the autumn months in Cape Town, and some of the wettest. Temperatures are similar to spring, but days may feature heavy downpours. It doesn't rain every day, however-and when it does, it's the perfect opportunity to explore Cape Town's museums and restaurants. Cape Town's Climate. Cape Town has a Mediterranean style climate, with warm summers and mild, quite wet winters. Because of the surrounding mountains, Cape Town has many microclimates, and some parts of the city receive dramatically more rainfall than others.

Cape Town: Annual Weather Averages. February is the hottest month in Cape Town with an average temperature of 23°C (73°F) and the coldest is June at 13°C (55°F) with the most daily sunshine hours at 11 in December. The wettest month is July with an average of 100mm of rain. The best month to swim in the sea is in February when the average sea temperature is 21°C (70°F).

Chatham, Cape Cod Weather. Weather. SUMMER: Chatham lies far out at sea on the elbow of the Cape, at Latitude 41.40 North and Longitude 69.58 West. We are fortunate in having navigable waters on almost three sides, and, as a result, the average summer temperature is close to 70 degrees.

Free 2-Month Weather Forecast. OCTOBER 2015: temperature 59° (3° above avg.); precipitation 5 (1.5 above avg.); Oct 1-7: Sunny, warm; Oct 8-13: Rain, then sunny, cool; Oct 14-19: Rainy periods, mild; Oct 20-25: Sunny, cool north; showers, warm south; Oct 26-31: Rainy periods, turning cooler. Winter will be colder and snowier than normal in the north, with near-normal temperatures and below-normal snowfall in the south. The coldest period will be in mid-January, with cold weather also occurring in late December, most of January, mid-February, and early March.

During summer (November to February) the temperature on the coast generally ranges between 15°C and 35°C (while inland it increases by approximately 3-5°C), although recent summers have seen temperatures in the City Bowl soaring to over 40°C. In winter (May to August) it ranges between 7°C and 18°C.
